com.pfa

Class ImageConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pfa.ImageConversion

  • public class ImageConversion
extends java.lang.Object
    Aggregate of conversion's methods for an image

      • saveImage

        static boolean saveImage(Mat img,
                         java.lang.String filename)
        Save the image on the phone (for testing only) The image will be saved in the /PFA directory
        Parameters:
        img - the image to save (in RGB format)
        filename - the name of the image
        Returns:
        true if the image was successfully saved, false otherwise

      • saveDisparity

        static boolean saveDisparity(Mat img,
                             java.lang.String filename)
        Save the disparity image on the phone (for testing only) The image will be saved in the /PFA directory
        Parameters:
        img - the disparity to save (in grayscale format)
        filename - the name of the disparity image
        Returns:
        true if the image was successfully saved, false otherwise

        Load an image from the phone (for testing only) The image must be located in the /PFA directory
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the image to load
        Returns:
        the loaded image

        Returns:

      • convertToAnaglyph

        static void convertToAnaglyph(Mat left,
                              Mat right,
                              Mat dest)
        Convert two images (left and right view) into a red-cyan anaglyph image The left and right images must have the same size
        Parameters:
        left - the left-view image
        right - the right-view image
        dest - the matrix where the anaglyph image will be stored

      • convertToSideBySide

        static void convertToSideBySide(Mat left,
                                Mat right,
                                Mat dest)
        Convert two images (left and right view) into a side-by-side image The left and right images must have the same size
        Parameters:
        left - the left-view image
        right - the right-view image
        dest - the matrix where the side-by-side image will be stored

      • heatmapConversion

        static Mat heatmapConversion(CameraBridgeViewBase.CvCameraViewFrame inputFrame,
                             Disparity2 disparity)

      • full3DConversion

        static int full3DConversion(Mat img,
                            Mat dst,
                            java.lang.String conversionType)
        Perform a full 3D conversion of the given image img
        Parameters:
        img - the image to convert into 3D
        dst - the image where the 3D image will be stored
        conversionType - a string representing the type of 3D, either "Anaglyph" or "Side by side"
        Returns:
        the columns that were cropped from the input image comparing to the output image

      • full3DConversionDummy

        static int full3DConversionDummy(Mat img,
                                 Mat dst,
                                 java.lang.String conversionType)
        Perform a full 3D conversion of the given image img (for testing only) In this function, the disparity map is just a matrix where each pixel has the same value
        Parameters:
        img - the image to convert into 3D
        dst - the image where the 3D image will be stored
        conversionType - a string representing the type of 3D, either "Anaglyph", "Side by side" or "None"
        Returns:
        the columns that were cropped from the input image comparing to the output image

      • addSurroundingPixel

        static void addSurroundingPixel(byte[] pixels,
                                int index,
                                int[] rgb,
                                int[] surroundingPixelsNb)
        Add the pixel value to the pixel sum rgb (used for extrapolation)
        Parameters:
        pixels - the image buffer containing all the pixels of the image
        index - the index of the pixel to add to the sum
        rgb - the current pixels sum
        surroundingPixelsNb - the number of pixel added to the sum so far

      • extrapolatePixelValue

        static void extrapolatePixelValue(byte[] dest,
                                  int rows,
                                  int cols,
                                  int step,
                                  int i,
                                  int j,
                                  boolean[][] computedPixels)
        Extrapolate a pixel value from its neighbors The function computes the average of the neighbors (maximum 8 pixels) of a pixel and assigns the value to the pixel
        Parameters:
        dest - the image buffer containing all the pixels of the image
        rows - the number of rows of the image
        cols - the number of columns of the image
        step - the step of the image
        i - the i coordinate of the pixel to extrapolate
        j - the j coordinate of the pixel to extrapolate
        computedPixels - array of booleans indicating which pixels were already computed

      • handleOcclusionsWithSurroundingPixelsAverage

        static void handleOcclusionsWithSurroundingPixelsAverage(byte[] dest,
                                                         int rows,
                                                         int cols,
                                                         int step,
                                                         boolean[][] computedPixels,
                                                         boolean leftInput)
        Extrapolate all pixels that do not have a value after the disparity was applied
        Parameters:
        dest - the image buffer containing all the pixels of the image
        rows - the number of rows of the image
        cols - the number of columns of the image
        step - the step of the image
        computedPixels - array of booleans indicating which pixels were already computed
        leftInput - boolean indicating whether the input image was the left-view or right-view image

      • computeCorrespondingImage

        static int computeCorrespondingImage(Mat img,
                                     Mat disparity,
                                     Mat dest,
                                     boolean leftInput,
                                     int disparityScale)
        Compute the image corresponding to the other view of the input image (i.e. left or right)
        Parameters:
        img - the image whose other view is to be computed
        disparity - the disparity map corresponding to the input image
        dest - the matrix where the computed image will be stored
        leftInput - boolean indicating whether the input image is the left-view or the right-view
        disparityScale - number by which each disparity value must be divided
        Returns:
        the columns that were cropped from the input image comparing to the output image
